suggestions.suggestion: Implement user authentication to ensure only authorized users can access and manage tasks.
suggestions.rationale: Without authentication, anyone could potentially access or manipulate tasks, leading to unauthorized access and data breaches.

suggestions.suggestion: Enforce role-based access control (RBAC) to restrict task management actions (add, edit, delete) to appropriate user roles.
suggestions.rationale: RBAC ensures that only users with the correct permissions can perform sensitive actions, reducing the risk of accidental or malicious changes.

suggestions.suggestion: Validate and sanitize all user inputs for task fields (title, description, priority, due date, tag) to prevent injection attacks such as SQL injection and XSS.
suggestions.rationale: Unvalidated inputs can be exploited to execute malicious code or access unauthorized data, compromising system integrity.

suggestions.suggestion: Encrypt sensitive data at rest and in transit, especially if tasks contain personal or sensitive information.
suggestions.rationale: Encryption protects data from unauthorized access in case of data breaches or interception during transmission.

suggestions.suggestion: Use secure communication protocols (HTTPS/TLS) for all client-server interactions.
suggestions.rationale: Secure protocols prevent eavesdropping and man-in-the-middle attacks, ensuring data confidentiality and integrity.

suggestions.suggestion: Implement audit logging for all task management actions (add, edit, delete, status change) to support monitoring and incident response.
suggestions.rationale: Audit logs help detect suspicious activities and provide forensic evidence in case of security incidents.

suggestions.suggestion: Handle errors gracefully and avoid exposing sensitive information in error messages.
suggestions.rationale: Detailed error messages can leak system information that attackers can exploit.
